user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_empty:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_empty (enum MHD_ResponseFlags flags)
{
  struct MHD_Response *r;
  r = (struct MHD_Response *) MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_Response));
  if (NULL != r)
  {
    if (MHD_mutex_init_ (&r->mutex))
    {
      r->fd = -1;
      r->reference_count = 1;
      /* If any flags combination will be not allowed, replace the next
       * assignment with MHD_set_response_options() call. */
      r->flags = flags;

      return r; /* Successful result */
    }
    free (r);
  }
  return NULL; /* Something failed */
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_create_response_empty:
#define _MHD_EXTERN __attribute__((visibility("default")))extern
...
#define MHD_calloc_(n, s) calloc((n),(s))
...
#define MHD_mutex_init_(pmutex) (!(pthread_mutex_init((pmutex),NULL)))
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: The only language-compiler extension present is the use of the GCC attribute syntax (__attribute__((visibility("default")))) in the _MHD_EXTERN macro definition; this is documented as a compiler extension. Other code fragments do not use compiler-specific language extensions: MHD_calloc_ expands to the standard C library calloc, the explicit cast of the calloc result is standard C (not a compiler extension), MHD_mutex_init_ expands to a call to the POSIX pthread_mutex_init function (a platform API, not a compiler language extension), and the rest are plain C constructs (structs, enums, function definition, return, if, NULL, free). Therefore those other fragments do not need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
